- Anaemic syndrome, often rapid in onset and therefore poorly tolerated

- Haemorrhagic syndrome secondary to thrombocytopenia (mucocutaneous bleeding, purpura, etc.) sometimes aggravated by disseminated intravascular coagulation secondary to the disease.

- Infectious syndrome associated with neutropenia: fever, ulcerative colitis, pneumonia, etc. The clinical picture is usually poor.

question.title: What is a common clinical sign of bone marrow failure?

option_b.title: Anaemic syndrome, often rapid in onset and therefore poorly tolerated

option_c.title: Infectious syndrome associated with neutropenia: fever, ulcerative colitis, pneumonia, etc.

option_d.title: Haemorrhagic syndrome secondary to thrombocytopenia (mucocutaneous bleeding, purpura, etc.) sometimes aggravated by disseminated intravascular coagulation secondary to the disease.

correct_option.title: B
